question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_with_dependencies()] [Block_on deadlock] Can block_on(callback_receiver) deadlock if the spawned thread panics before sending, causing permanent shard freeze? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_with_dependencies()] [Arc reference leak] Are all Arc clones (cross_shard_state_view_clone, cross_shard_client_clone) properly dropped, or can circular references cause memory leaks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_with_dependencies()] [Round mismatch attack] Can mismatched round numbers between send_cross_shard_msg calls cause messages to be routed to wrong execution contexts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_with_dependencies()] [Concurrent scope violation] Can scope.spawn closures escape the scope lifetime, causing dangling references to stack-allocated data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_with_dependencies()] [Transaction provider bypass] Can DefaultTxnProvider::new_without_info skip critical transaction validation like sequence number checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Sequential ordering attack] Can an attacker manipulate SubBlocksForShard ordering to execute dependent transactions before their dependencies, breaking causality? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Round enumeration vulnerability] Does enumerate() properly handle usize overflow if there are billions of rounds, causing incorrect round numbers in metrics and cross-shard messages? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Metrics manipulation] Can crafted shard_id or round values cause SHARDED_BLOCK_EXECUTION_BY_ROUNDS_SECONDS metrics to overflow or corrupt monitoring data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Transaction count attack] Can malicious sub_block.transactions.len() values in SHARDED_BLOCK_EXECUTOR_TXN_COUNT cause f64 conversion overflow or infinity? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Early termination exploit] If execute_sub_block returns Err for round N, are subsequent rounds skipped causing incomplete block execution and state inconsistency? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Result accumulation bug] Can result.push() fail to preserve transaction order if sub-blocks execute in unexpected order due to compiler optimizations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Config reuse vulnerability] Is config.clone() safe for reuse across rounds, or can mutable state in BlockExecutorConfig cause non-deterministic execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [State view sharing] Can the same state_view reference across multiple rounds cause cross-contamination if sub-blocks modify cached state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Timer side effects] Can SHARDED_BLOCK_EXECUTION_BY_ROUNDS_SECONDS timer creation/drop have observable side effects that break determinism? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Empty sub-block attack] Can empty sub_blocks (zero transactions) cause division by zero or skip critical state transitions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: start()] [Command injection] Can coordinator_client.receive_execute_command() be manipulated to inject malicious ExecutorShardCommand variants not expected by the match statement? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: start()] [Counter overflow] Can num_txns += transactions.num_txns() overflow usize after processing billions of transactions, causing incorrect TPS calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: start()] [State view lifetime violation] After drop(state_view), can lingering references in execute_block cause use-after-free vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: start()] [Concurrency level manipulation] Can concurrency_level_per_shard be set to 0 or extreme values causing division by zero or thread pool exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: start()] [Infinite loop DoS] Can the coordinator never send ExecutorShardCommand::Stop, causing infinite loop and resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/sharded_executor_service.rs] [Function: start()] [Result channel blocking] Can send_execution_result block indefinitely if coordinator stops receiving, freezing shard execution? (High)
